description: Change of use from offices (Use Class B1) to dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) involving demolition of existing two-storey office building and construction of two three-storey semi-detached dwellings, associated cycle and waste storeage, removal of vehicle crossing and reinstatement of footpath.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawing title numbers: C230-11 - Proposed Roof Plan, Rev B, Date September 2015; C230-12 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan, Rev B, Date September 2015; C230-13 - Proposed First & Second Floor Plans, Rev B, Date September 2015; C230-15 - Proposed Front & Rear Elevations, Rev B, Date September 2015; C230-16 - Proposed Side Elevations, Rev B, Date September 2015; C230-17 - Proposed Long Section, Rev B, Date September 2015; C222-21 - Proposed North-West View, Rev A, Date September 2015; C222-22 - Proposed Front View, Rev A, Date September 2015; C222-23 - Proposed South-West View, Rev A, Date September 2015.

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with the details indicated on the approved plans.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to the commencement of the development (except demolition and site clearance) the following shall be submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority:

(a)	An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site. This shall be carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site.

(b)	A remediation (de-contamination) scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. It shall include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures.  The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.
Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation (de-contamination) scheme part (b)

(c)	A verification report that demonstrates the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme shall be produced. The report shall be compiled in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

REASON: The historic uses of the site may have resulted in contamination and this condition is required to ensure the site is remediated and does not pose a risk to future residents in accordance with policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015, Policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD 2013 and 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole,  in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) (h), 1.2 (f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage has been provided as shown on the approved plans and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Ealing Management DPD (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015). | A minimum of four (4) cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site in the curtilage of the dwelling in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan 2015. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until the existing crossover (extending for the full width of the site) is removed, footpath reinstated and two on-street parking spaces provided with works completed to the satisfaction of Council's Highways Department. These works shall be implemented for the full width of the site and shall be retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

REASON: In the interests of highway safety, in accordance with the Councils Adopted Sustainable Transport for New Development Supplementary Planning Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2015). | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2015); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | The development shall achieve compliance with an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) inside the bedrooms with the windows shut and other means of ventilation provided and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves) or NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves) inside the living rooms with the windows shut and other means of ventilation provided.

REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2015), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
